solution_line_template: First find how much the electrician earns per day: ${worker_daily_pay}/day * {electrician_multiplier} = $<<{worker_daily_pay}*{electrician_multiplier}={electrician_daily_pay}>>{electrician_daily_pay}/day

Then find how much the plumber earns per day: ${worker_daily_pay}/day * {plumber_percentage_text}% = $<<{worker_daily_pay}*{plumber_percentage_value_in_calc}*{percent_factor}={plumber_daily_pay}>>{plumber_daily_pay}/day

Then find how much both workers pay together: ${worker_daily_pay}/day/worker * {num_construction_workers} workers = $<<{worker_daily_pay}*{num_construction_workers}={construction_workers_total_pay}>>{construction_workers_total_pay}/day

Then add the cost of each worker to find the total labor cost per day: ${electrician_daily_pay}/day + ${plumber_daily_pay}/day + ${construction_workers_total_pay}/day = $<<{electrician_daily_pay}+{plumber_daily_pay}+{construction_workers_total_pay}={total_labor_cost}>>{total_labor_cost}/day
